name: Hotel de Seine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We made reservations six months in advance to stay here for 2 nights. After a very difficult journey (no taxis due to the Gay Pride parade), we arrived late in the day only to find that the room was not available. At all. The man at the desk informed us that there was "damage" to the room and that he had emailed us that morning. Of course, we didn't receive that email while on the train from Toulouse. Worse, he let us know that because we were only staying 2 nights, we were bumped for another guest who was staying longer. Seriously? In fairness, he had booked us a room elsewhere. (No rest for the weary- our new hotel featured the parade grandstand and amplified street music.) Reading these reviews, it sounds like HdS was what we hoped for. We'll never know.
reviews.title: bumped!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at Hotel de Seine and all I can say is Location, Location, Location - this hotel had it! I researched long and hard as to where to stay and I was so happy with my choice and value for money.
reviews.title: A really enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located on Rue de Seine, right in the heart of all the action of St Germaine, great restaurants, shops, markets, and a very short stroll to the River Seine and across the bridge at you are at The Lourve.
reviews.title: Perfect location?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room itself was small, but it is Paris and the decor was very parisian, but we loved it and the bathroom was huge - for Europe and also for a lot of Western hotels. We had lovely windows that let in light and a nice view down to all the action on the street. But it wasn't noisy.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: All the staff were wonderful and spoke excellent english and were always very helpful. And likewise with all the bars and restaurants around, everyone was very friendly.
reviews.title: Best Hotel fro the Value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, friendly staff (thanks for the converter/iron/chocolate Easter eggs!). We were told that Paris hotel rooms were small and that hold true for this hotel. Go to a patisserie for breakfast, skip the hotel one. WiFi was spotty, kept having to re-enter password. Dozens of outdoor cafes and restaurants within walking distance. Great stay overall!
reviews.title: Small (but cozy)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Enjoyed a very pleasant stay at the Hotel de Seine. The location can't be beat. Within walking distance to so many attractions/activities. The staff was helpful and friendly. The room was clean and comfortable. We stayed in a front room and were not at all bothered by any street noise. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Wonderful Find in a Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We picked this hotel for the location in the sixth district. It was perfect. We were able to easily walk to everything in Paris in minutes. Near the hotel are many fine restaurants. We had the hotel make use reservations for dinner each night, and were able to get into many great places.
reviews.title: Great Location and Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The rooms are small, and the beds are short, but it was clean, quiet, free wi-fi, and plenty of hot water. No real complaints
reviews.title: A bit of breakfast variety, please!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: I stay here often, and have reviewed the hotel positively in the past. On many levels, this is a lovely small hotel - the location is brilliant, the staff are very pleasant, and the rooms - without being exceptional - are clean, comfortable (if, like me, you like firm beds), and quiet (if you choose those at the rear). For all these reasons, I endorse the positive reviews that the hotel usually gets. My one gripe is that, as a regular visitor, I feel a bit frustrated by the lack of variety. Breakfast at the hotel has remained unchanged for the four years that I have visited. Despite my hints, fruit has never made it onto the array of choices. Individual staff members know my preference for fruit, and are kind enough to bring in the odd banana if they remember. Congratulations on this positive approach to customer service, but why not make breakfast a bit more interesting for everyone?
reviews.title: Good location, but rooms look nicer online than in reality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: this is truly a find in the 6th........walking over to the Louvre, Notre Dame, etc. is close.....and St. Germain is a block or two away. The staff was so helpful and friendly....the room was comfortable with the period furniture. Great restaurants a half a block of away. would definitely stay there again!
reviews.title: Great location, staff and size

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my husband and i spent 3 nights at this wonderful little hotel on a friend's recommendation. the hotel is perfect depending on how you adjust your expectations. the major plus of the hotel is the location, it could not have been more centrally located, as many others have noted below, right in the heart of st germaine, within short walking distance of many sights and attractions and just a few blocks from several metro stops. our room itself was small and basic, but very clean and nicely appointed, and we managed just fine with quite a bit of luggage (as we'd been traveling for weeks before paris). the staff were warm, helpful and friendly, and the hotel offers a charming lounge and lobby area. i would just mention that there is no fridge in the room (though guests have easy access to hotel fridge in the lobby) and there is no kettle for tea/coffee in the room. the hotel offers tea/coffee upon request but there is a charge of 7 euro. wifi is also slow and spotty. this notwithstanding, so long as you are prepared for these minor inconveniences, the hotel is otherwise overall great!
reviews.title: little gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011
reviews.text: Recently stayed for over a week. We found the property very well situated for exploring the city on foot or by Metro. The busy intersection of St Germaine and St Michele is close yet the hotel is on a quiet old street just down from the Rue de Bucci shopping. Everything you need is at hand. Plenty of cafes and bakeries near. Also a grocery. Several Metro stops and the RER are within an easy walk. The staff were charming and helpful. Our room was clean and nicely furnished and offered free wifi. The only missing amenity that might make an improvement would be a mini refrigerator. Overall we were very pleased and would stay at Hotel de Seine again on our next trip to Paris. It provides good value.
reviews.title: Quiet, Charming Left Bank Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this wonderful hotel. This was our second time and enjoyed as much, if not more, than the last. Staff is fantastic and location cannot be beat. Highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel de Seine was a vital part of our best ever trip to Paris in fall of 2011. Starting at check in (at least 3 hours early and yet we got a room immediately) and throughout our stay our experience was outstanding in so many ways. Our simple but very clean and nicely appointed room was a perfect place to relax after a long day of enjoying the Paris sights which literally start as you walk out of the hotel.
reviews.title: LOVE Hotel de Seine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a few weeks during the French Open at Roland Garros. The hotel is charmingly upscale but not pretentiously luxurious. It's very antique in atmosphere while still offering modern touches like LCD TVs and WiFi Internet access. The room was a decent size even considering European rooms are smaller than American rooms. The bathroom was bit smaller but nice. The staff at the hotel was simply amazing. Every front desk member spoke English and was friendly and helpful every time I saw them. The location is perfectly located in the district of Saint Germain near the thriving Rue de Buci where you can find the best food, shopping, and cafes within a block or two. Highly recommend dining at Chez Fernand for an authentic French cuisine experience at a good price for amazing food. It's walking distance to the Musee de Louvre, the Cathedral de Notre Dame, or two Metro stations that can get you anywhere in the city in 15 minutes. Only suggestion and it's minor, you have to reenter the username and password every time you want to connect to the WiFi. If you want that impersonal sterile brand new hotel experience go elsewhere. If you want that friendly aged authentic Parisian hotel experience this is it. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Wonderful boutique hotel, Perfect location, Fantastic staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's difficult to believe that the other reviewers stayed in the same hotel. With previous experience of a 3 star hotel in the 6th, we expected a better standard. Our room (No 11) was at the back of the hotel overlooking a dark and grubby courtyard, with views of a roof littered with cigarette butts. The room was dark and dingy too, but it was clean. None of the coathangers worked, so we were forced to live out of our suitcases. There was 1 pillow each on the bed, and when we requested more, there were no more pillows in the hotel! A small child's pillow was produced. The shower screen was so inadequate that the bathroom was awash after each shower. The receptionists were polite, especially one helpful and cheerful young man. The furniture was shabby and nothing looked as it does on the website.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The rooms at the Hotel de Seine were superb: comfortable, clean and spacious. We were a family of three (3) in Paris for eight (8) days and the family suite was perfect. Our past experience in Paris left us with a fear of the size and functionality of the bathroom, but we were pleasantly surprised here: the bathroom was a good size, plenty of room, the "hot" water was truly hot and the water pressure in the shower better than ours at home. Having said all that, the highlight of this hotel is the staff, all of whom made ​​all the difference. Each one of the clerks in the office to the cleaning staff are very friendly, accomodating and hospitable, they did everything to make our stay as pleasant as possible. To top everything off, the location of this property is wonderful: convenient to the Metro and within walking distance to most everything. This trip was truly the best vacation we have ever had and the Hotel de Seine had a lot to do with that! We look forward to returning to Paris and will most definately stay here again.
reviews.title: The Perfect Paris Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: By most measures the Hotel de Seine is a perfectly adequate mid-price tourist hotel in Paris, just about what you might expect from a 3-star mid-level facility in an expensive tourist-driven city. What sets it apart from others that fit that description are two things: (1) outstanding staff service (especially at the front desk...by Audrey and Tristan especially...but they are all good), and (2) its unbeatable location.
reviews.title: Location, location, location...and staff service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You simply can't beat Hotel de Seine's location if you are a tourist -- it sits in the middle of the Soho-ish St. Germain des Pres neighborhood in the trendy 6th arrondissement: 5 minutes' walk from Odeon metro stop, 10 minutes' walk from the Ile de la Cite in one direction and the Luxembourg Gardens on the other, adjacent to the Latin Quarter's Boulevard St. Michel and its hectic atmosphere, and surrounded by scores of bustling and crowded cafes, bistros, bakeries, restaurants, galleries and shops of all kinds.
reviews.title: Stay Here!

description: Either you are a businessman or a tourist, you will appreciate the Hotel de Seine. It is located right in the heart of Saint Germain-des-Prés, well-known to be alive by day and night, in the rue de Seine which runs from the Luxembourg gardens to the banks of the Seine and its famous flower market.You will enjoy a personalized welcome, a modern comfortand magnificent antique furniture.Brand new air conditioning system since April 2010 !!
